contextItems.name: 17-cleanup.sh
contextItems.content:
```build_files/base/17-cleanup.sh
#!/usr/bin/bash

echo "::group:: ===$(basename "$0")==="

# Disable uupd from updating distroboxes
sed -i 's|uupd|& --disable-module-distrobox|' /usr/lib/systemd/system/uupd.service

set -eoux pipefail

# Setup Systemd
systemctl enable rpm-ostree-countme.service
systemctl enable tailscaled.service
systemctl enable dconf-update.service
systemctl enable ublue-guest-user.service
systemctl enable brew-setup.service
systemctl enable brew-upgrade.timer
systemctl enable brew-update.timer
systemctl enable aurora-groups.service
systemctl enable usr-share-sddm-themes.mount
systemctl enable ublue-fix-hostname.service
systemctl enable ublue-system-setup.service
systemctl --global enable ublue-user-setup.service
systemctl --global enable podman-auto-update.timer
systemctl enable check-sb-key.service
systemctl enable input-remapper.service

# Nuke possible Fedora flatpak repos
systemctl enable flatpak-nuke-fedora.service

# TODO: Reinvestigate when bazaar gains dbus activation
systemctl --global enable bazaar.service

# run flatpak preinstall once at startup
systemctl enable flatpak-preinstall.service

# disable sunshine service
systemctl --global disable sunshine.service

# Updater
systemctl enable uupd.timer

# Disable the old update timer
systemctl disable rpm-ostreed-automatic.timer
systemctl disable flatpak-system-update.timer

# Hide Desktop Files. Hidden removes mime associations
for file in htop nvtop; do
    if [[ -f "/usr/share/applications/${file}.desktop" ]]; then
        desktop-file-edit --set-key=Hidden --set-value=true /usr/share/applications/${file}.desktop
    fi
done

#Add the Flathub Flatpak remote and remove the Fedora Flatpak remote
flatpak remote-add --system --if-not-exists flathub https://flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo
systemctl disable flatpak-add-fedora-repos.service

# NOTE: With isolated COPR installation, most repos are never enabled globally.
# We only need to clean up repos that were enabled during the build process.

# Disable third-party repos
for repo in negativo17-fedora-multimedia tailscale fedora-cisco-openh264; do
    if [[ -f "/etc/yum.repos.d/${repo}.repo" ]]; then
        sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "/etc/yum.repos.d/${repo}.repo"
    fi
done

# Disable hardware:razer repo if it exists (only on F42)
if [[ -f "/etc/yum.repos.d/hardware:razer.repo" ]]; then
    sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' /etc/yum.repos.d/hardware:razer.repo
fi

# Disable Terra repos (installed on F42 and earlier)
for i in /etc/yum.repos.d/terra*.repo; do
    if [[ -f "$i" ]]; then
        sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "$i"
    fi
done

# Disable all COPR repos (should already be disabled by helpers, but ensure)
for i in /etc/yum.repos.d/_copr:*.repo; do
    if [[ -f "$i" ]]; then
        sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "$i"
    fi
done

# NOTE: we won't use dnf5 copr plugin for ublue-os/akmods until our upstream provides the COPR standard naming
if [[ -f "/etc/yum.repos.d/_copr_ublue-os-akmods.repo" ]]; then
    sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' /etc/yum.repos.d/_copr_ublue-os-akmods.repo
fi

# Disable RPM Fusion repos
for i in /etc/yum.repos.d/rpmfusion-*.repo; do
    if [[ -f "$i" ]]; then
        sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "$i"
    fi
done

# Disable fedora-coreos-pool if it exists
if [ -f /etc/yum.repos.d/fedora-coreos-pool.repo ]; then
    sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' /etc/yum.repos.d/fedora-coreos-pool.repo
fi

echo "::endgroup::"

```

message.content:
**Feedback on `build_files/base/17‑cleanup.sh`**

Overall the script is well‑structured, idempotent where possible, and follows good practices (e.g., `set -eoux pipefail`, grouping output for CI). Below are some observations, suggestions, and minor improvements you might consider.

---

### 1. Shebang & Execution Environment
```bash
#!/usr/bin/bash
```
* **Suggestion:** Use `/usr/bin/env bash` to be more portable across distributions that may place Bash in a different location.
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash
```

---

### 2. CI Grouping Header
```bash
echo "::group:: ===$(basename "$0")==="
```
* Works fine for GitHub Actions. If you ever run this script outside of GH Actions, the `::group::` syntax will just be printed – that’s harmless.

---

### 3. Disabling uupd module injection
```bash
sed -i 's|uupd|& --disable-module-distrobox|' /usr/lib/systemd/system/uupd.service
```
* **Potential issue:** Running `sed` on a system‑wide unit file may break the package manager’s ability to upgrade that unit later (the change will be overwritten).  
  *If you control the image build and this is intentional, it’s fine. Otherwise consider creating an override drop‑in instead:*
```bash
mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/uupd.service.d
cat > /etc/systemd/system/uupd.service.d/disable-distrobox.conf <<'EOF'
[Service]
ExecStart=
ExecStart=/usr/libexec/uupd --disable-module-distrobox …
EOF
systemctl daemon-reload
```

---

### 4. `set -eoux pipefail`
* Good for early failure detection.
* **Tip:** If you later add commands that intentionally may fail (e.g., disabling a service that might not exist), wrap them with `|| true` or use `if ...; then …; fi`.

---

### 5. Enabling Services
```bash
systemctl enable rpm-ostree-countme.service
...
systemctl --global enable podman-auto-update.timer
```
* **Consistency:** You mix plain `enable` and `--global enable`. It’s clear you want some services system‑wide and others for the user. Consider adding a comment block separating *system* vs *user* services for readability.
* **Idempotency:** `systemctl enable` is already idempotent, so no extra checks needed.

---

### 6. Disabling/Enabling Flatpak Repos & Services
```bash
flatpak remote-add --system --if-not-exists flathub …
systemctl disable flatpak-add-fedora-repos.service
```
* Good use of `--if-not-exists`.  
* You might also want to ensure the *flathub* repo is trusted (e.g., verify its GPG key) if this runs on a fresh image.

---

### 7. Loop Over Desktop Files
```bash
for file in htop nvtop; do
    if [[ -f "/usr/share/applications/${file}.desktop" ]]; then
        desktop-file-edit --set-key=Hidden --set-value=true /usr/share/applications/${file}.desktop
    fi
done
```
* Works, but consider using `command -v desktop-file-edit >/dev/null || continue` to avoid errors if the utility isn’t installed.

---

### 8. Repo Disabling Logic
You have many loops that replace `enabled=1` with `enabled=0`. A few points:

| Observation | Recommendation |
|-------------|----------------|
| Repeated `sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' …` patterns | Extract to a small helper function for readability, e.g., `disable_repo() { sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "$1"; }`. |
| Using glob loops (`for i in /etc/yum.repos.d/_copr:*.repo; do …`) – if the glob doesn’t match any file, Bash will iterate over the literal pattern. | Add `shopt -s nullglob` at the top (or before each loop) to avoid processing non‑existent patterns. |
| Some repos are disabled twice (`rpmfusion-*.repo` already covered by generic “disable all COPR repos” logic). | Not harmful, but you could consolidate to a single “disable everything under `/etc/yum.repos.d/` that contains `enabled=1`”. |
| Hard‑coded repo names (e.g., `negativo17-fedora-multimedia`). If the upstream changes name, script will silently skip. | Consider adding a comment noting that these are expected to exist for the target base image. |

**Example helper:**
```bash
disable_repo_file() {
    local file=$1
    [[ -f "$file" ]] && sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "$file"
}
```
Then:
```bash
for repo in negativo17-fedora-multimedia tailscale fedora-cisco-openh264; do
    disable_repo_file "/etc/yum.repos.d/${repo}.repo"
done
```

---

### 9. Safety Checks Before `sed` on System Files
All `sed -i` commands assume the file is writable. In a typical image build environment this is fine, but if you ever run the script in a hardened container where `/etc/yum.repos.d/` is read‑only, it will abort because of `set -e`.  
*Potential mitigation:* Wrap each `sed` in a conditional that checks write permission:
```bash
[[ -w "$file" ]] && sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "$file"
```

---

### 10. End‑Group Marker
```bash
echo "::endgroup::"
```
* Good – matches the opening group.

---

## Summary of Suggested Changes

| Area | Change |
|------|--------|
| Shebang | Use `#!/usr/bin/env bash` |
| uupd service modification | Prefer a systemd drop‑in override instead of editing the unit file directly |
| Repo‑disable loops | Add `shopt -s nullglob`; optionally create a helper function to reduce repetition |
| Desktop file edit | Guard against missing `desktop-file-edit` binary |
| Comments & organization | Separate sections (system services, user services, repo cleanup) with clear headings |
| Optional safety checks | Verify write permission before mutating files |

If you’d like me to apply any of these changes directly to the script, just let me know which ones and I’ll edit the file for you.

#!/usr/bin/bash

echo "::group:: ===$(basename "$0")==="

# Disable uupd from updating distroboxes
sed -i 's|uupd|& --disable-module-distrobox|' /usr/lib/systemd/system/uupd.service

set -eoux pipefail

# Setup Systemd
systemctl enable rpm-ostree-countme.service
systemctl enable tailscaled.service
systemctl enable dconf-update.service
systemctl enable ublue-guest-user.service
systemctl enable brew-setup.service
systemctl enable brew-upgrade.timer
systemctl enable brew-update.timer
systemctl enable aurora-groups.service
systemctl enable usr-share-sddm-themes.mount
systemctl enable ublue-fix-hostname.service
systemctl enable ublue-system-setup.service
systemctl --global enable ublue-user-setup.service
systemctl --global enable podman-auto-update.timer
systemctl enable check-sb-key.service
systemctl enable input-remapper.service

# Nuke possible Fedora flatpak repos
systemctl enable flatpak-nuke-fedora.service

# TODO: Reinvestigate when bazaar gains dbus activation
systemctl --global enable bazaar.service

# run flatpak preinstall once at startup
systemctl enable flatpak-preinstall.service

# disable sunshine service
systemctl --global disable sunshine.service

# Updater
systemctl enable uupd.timer

# Disable the old update timer
systemctl disable rpm-ostreed-automatic.timer
systemctl disable flatpak-system-update.timer

# Hide Desktop Files. Hidden removes mime associations
for file in htop nvtop; do
    if [[ -f "/usr/share/applications/${file}.desktop" ]]; then
        desktop-file-edit --set-key=Hidden --set-value=true /usr/share/applications/${file}.desktop
    fi
done

#Add the Flathub Flatpak remote and remove the Fedora Flatpak remote
flatpak remote-add --system --if-not-exists flathub https://flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo
systemctl disable flatpak-add-fedora-repos.service

# NOTE: With isolated COPR installation, most repos are never enabled globally.
# We only need to clean up repos that were enabled during the build process.

# Disable third-party repos
for repo in negativo17-fedora-multimedia tailscale fedora-cisco-openh264; do
    if [[ -f "/etc/yum.repos.d/${repo}.repo" ]]; then
        sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "/etc/yum.repos.d/${repo}.repo"
    fi
done

# Disable hardware:razer repo if it exists (only on F42)
if [[ -f "/etc/yum.repos.d/hardware:razer.repo" ]]; then
    sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' /etc/yum.repos.d/hardware:razer.repo
fi

# Disable Terra repos (installed on F42 and earlier)
for i in /etc/yum.repos.d/terra*.repo; do
    if [[ -f "$i" ]]; then
        sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "$i"
    fi
done

# Disable all COPR repos (should already be disabled by helpers, but ensure)
for i in /etc/yum.repos.d/_copr:*.repo; do
    if [[ -f "$i" ]]; then
        sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "$i"
    fi
done

# NOTE: we won't use dnf5 copr plugin for ublue-os/akmods until our upstream provides the COPR standard naming
if [[ -f "/etc/yum.repos.d/_copr_ublue-os-akmods.repo" ]]; then
    sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' /etc/yum.repos.d/_copr_ublue-os-akmods.repo
fi

# Disable RPM Fusion repos
for i in /etc/yum.repos.d/rpmfusion-*.repo; do
    if [[ -f "$i" ]]; then
        sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' "$i"
    fi
done

# Disable fedora-coreos-pool if it exists
if [ -f /etc/yum.repos.d/fedora-coreos-pool.repo ]; then
    sed -i 's@enabled=1@enabled=0@g' /etc/yum.repos.d/fedora-coreos-pool.repo
fi

echo "::endgroup::"
